title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Marine
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Marine 

Equipment) (Amendment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (marine equipment) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the European Union
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the European Union 

(Marine Equipment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 177 of 2017).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean european union (marine equipment) regulation 2017 (s.i no 177 2017)

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended in paragraph (1) by
text_raw:
3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended in paragraph (1) by 

the insertion of the following definition: 

“ ‘Regulation of 2020’ means Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 
2020/1170 of 16 July 20202 on design, construction and performance 
requirements and testing standards for marine equipment and repealing 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/13973;”.
text_norm: 3 regulation 2 principal regulation amended paragraph (1) insertion following definition regulation 2020 mean commission implementing regulation (eu) 2020 1170 16 july 20202 design construction performance requirement testing standard marine equipment repealing implementing regulation (eu) 2019 13973

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 4. Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations is amended in paragraph
text_raw:
4. Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations is amended in paragraph 

(2)(b) by the substitution of “Regulation of 2020” for “Regulation of 2019”. 

1 OJ No. L 257, 28.8.2014, p.146. 
2 OJ No. L 264, 12.8.2020, p.1. 
3 OJ No. L 237, 13.9.2019, p.1. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th November, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [527] 3

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: 5. Regulation 46 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
5. Regulation 46 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) by the substitution, in paragraphs (4) and (5), of “Regulation of 

2020” for “Regulation of 2019”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (5): 

“(6) Marine equipment listed as a ‘new item inserted by 
Implementing Regulation 2020/1170’2 in column 1 of the Annex 
to the Regulation of 2020 which complies with the requirements 
for type-approval in force in the State before 1 September 2020 
may continue to be placed on the market or on board an Irish ship 
until 1 September 2023.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

16 November, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [527]

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and
heading: (This note is not part of the legal instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the legal instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Statutory Instrument amends the European Union (Marine Equipment) 
Regulations 2017 ( S.I. No. 177 of 2017 ), which gave effect to Directive 
2014/90/EU of 23 July 2014, to take account of Commission Implementing 
Regulation (EU) 2020/1170 of 16 July 2020 on design, construction and 
performance requirements and testing standards for marine equipment and 
repealing Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/1397. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [527] 5
